channel.title: Do not do transactions with a guy named mitchell or goodhosting
channel.description:
There's a guy named Mitchell doing "private transactions" for VPS hosting. I knew him from before so I bought a VPS 1GB from him. First few days of it were fine, but then the server started lagging unnecessarily. He said everything was running fine so I took his word for it and found ways to cut down on server load. Still lagging. Worse and worse each day until my players quit and my server was left to crumble to crap. I asked him to fix the problem because it was definitely not a server based issue. He did absolutely nothing and his replies were about a day apart for each. Then I sold my laptop and bought a new PC so I was offline for about 3 days before the new PC came in the mail. All booted up I go to check on my server and it turns out it's been offline since about the same time I sold my laptop, and I was unaware that my server had been offline this whole time! This was supposed to be a 99% uptime VPS so I was confused and confronted Mitchell about the problem. Or I would have, but he wouldn't reply. Two days later he tells me the server is running just fine. I tell him I can't even connect to the Remote Desktop and he investigates the issue. Another 3 days of me wondering what the hell is going on with my PAID service, and he finally tells me that there was a Server crash at the VPS company that he was routing me through (GoodHosting). Not to mention GoodHosting took 2-3 days on top of all that other time just to respond to his ticket. At this point I just want a refund. But Mitchell makes up his own terms and conditions on the spot and his first statement is "A refund is only made when there are technical issues with the VPS"....so after the technical issues I tell him i want a refund again, suddenly "Refunds are only made when the technical issues cause a downtime longer than 30 days." I ask him where this was written or agreed upon and he pulls the bullshit card of "It was a private sale. Terms do not have to be posted. These are my terms."
TL;DR Mitchell and GoodHosting are scam-artists.

item.title: Do not do transactions with a guy named mitchell or goodhosting
item.dc:creator: @Muroth Muroth
item.description:
@Muroth wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:20, topic:546613”][quote author=Lothy link=topic=665509.msg4450877#msg4450877 date=1411245659]
Correct. Traditionally we’ve left market stuff to scythe. Appointing middlemen, policing them, etc is a pain in the arse,
[/quote]
And literally anyone can scam or etc. A person can have 80,000,000 vouches and then scamquit on a person.
Sometimes the scammer is just waiting for the right deal, to make the most $$$ out of being banned from a community.[/quote]

++ done trades with people starting out and months later when they’re well known they get banned for scamming $100+ deals (rsgp)

Read full topic
item.source: Do not do transactions with a guy named mitchell or goodhosting

item.title: Do not do transactions with a guy named mitchell or goodhosting
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Lothy, post:16, topic:546613”][quote author=lare69 link=topic=665509.msg4449404#msg4449404 date=1410470297]
DO NOT DO TRANSACTIONS WITH ANYONE FROM MOPARSCAPE
[/quote]
It’d be wrong to assume that this place is a wretched hive of scum and villainy. People have been buying/selling services over time, mostly without issue. Occasionally you’ll see someone complain about a PayPal chargeback or whatever, but there are many other transactions that go ahead fine.

With that said, initiating these transactions in public is against the rules.[/quote]

AND THIS WOULD BE WHY.
Of the many reasons you could have behind adding a market to forums, this thread would be why a lot of people don’t like having it.
No one wants to sit here and deal with all the scams, whether they be a false report or not.
And no one wants to deal with threads like this, where people say generally what OP said.

Read full topic
item.source: Do not do transactions with a guy named mitchell or goodhosting

item.title: Do not do transactions with a guy named mitchell or goodhosting
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

lare69:

DO NOT DO TRANSACTIONS WITH ANYONE FROM MOPARSCAPE

It’d be wrong to assume that this place is a wretched hive of scum and villainy. People have been buying/selling services over time, mostly without issue. Occasionally you’ll see someone complain about a PayPal chargeback or whatever, but there are many other transactions that go ahead fine.

With that said, initiating these transactions in public is against the rules.

Read full topic

item.title: Do not do transactions with a guy named mitchell or goodhosting
item.dc:creator: @PaulT PaulT
item.description:
@PaulT wrote:

Appreciate the warning, but most people who have any experience with commerce probably know better than to enter into unsecured transactions with unknown individuals over the internet, ever. Hence, the sarcasm from a few users. But, appreciate the thought behind the post, and my sympathies go out to you, young padawan.

Read full topic

item.title: Do not do transactions with a guy named mitchell or goodhosting
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Paradox68, post:5, topic:546613”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=665509.msg4449047#msg4449047 date=1410320781]
TL;DR don’t buy from shady people and buy from reputable certified businesses…
[/quote]

I know but as I mentioned, I knew him from before I knew that he owned his own VPS business and he used to seem pretty cool, and we used to even talk about random shit so I figured he was friendly and then like 6 months later is when all this happened cause I had quit RSPS for a while then decided to get back into it and since i’d done business with him before and it went over nicely I figured i’d look to him for an affordable VPS but he didn’t even remember me and now he’s decided to be a dick.[/quote]
So was it an actual business? Because anyone can become a reseller, but you need to pay and do things to be an actual business, and if he did own an actual one, you can report it to the Better Business Bureau. If not a real business, and if he did not have any form of reputation your loss.
Seriously, have you heard of a search engine called google? It can get you plenty of results on a person, or a business/website. It’s helpful to get some reviews if you don’t trust the person. No matter how long you’ve known em.

And just because you know him over the internet, doesn’t mean you really know him. Anyone can have an alias… Plenty of people have loads of them, for scamming and etc… I was talking to someone for 3 years, and he didn’t even know how old I was (Best part: I met him on this website, AND my age is on my profile).

Read full topic
item.source: Do not do transactions with a guy named mitchell or goodhosting
